Title: Web 2.0, Microsoft, and the Costs at Scale

Author: mynameishere
Content: Now, you're going to hear a lot about how wonderful LISP (etc, etc) is, but remember that almost every _real_ application is in C (Unix), C++ (games, other desktop apps), or Java (50 million goddawful enterprise backends).

Author: juwo
Content:
Reforms often fail in India and France because unions can shut the country down through paralysing strikes. Why aren't they able to do so in America?

(e.g. Calcutta is a dying city because of this - a Bengali once told me).

Author: juwo
Title: Why are unions weak in the USA, but so powerful in France, India etc. even though they are bad for the economy?
